1) Add potatoes to perforated hotel pans and put in rationale oven. Steam potatoes until about 85% done and a knife can be easily inserted into the potatoe with little resistance, about 15-20 minutes.
2) Carefully spread potatoes out on sheet pan to cool. Put on speed racks.
3) IF APPLICABLE---When cool, tear apart by hand in rough chunks. Reserve for making classic potato salad.---- If NOT FOR POTATO SALAD, THERE IS NO NEED TO TEAR THEM UP
4) For service, fry potatoe chunks in 350* fryer until crispy on the outside and cooked throughout, about 4 minutes. Alternatively, roast in 450*F oven until crispy, about 15-20 minutes.
Allergens:
No known priority allergens.

1. Add eggs to appropriate cooking vessel 2. Cover with cold water by 1 inch 3. Bring to boil slowly over medium heat. Once boil is reached, remove from heat, cover and let sit for 12 minutes 4. Run eggs under cold water until cool 5. Place in appropriate vessel, label, date and refrigerate
Alternatively, eggs can be made in rationale oven by steaming on 100% steam for 13 minutes. Ensure to ice bath to bring down temperature and to stop the eggs from overcooking.

Notes:
1. There are 11.36Kg in 25 Lbs. Cases of Chow Mein Noodles come from Fresh Point in 25 Lbs boxes.
2. From Freshpoint we also get processed and unprocessed vegetables in 5 Lbs bags. This is why the "Bean Sprouts" and "Julienne Vegetables" are in those increments.
Prep:
- Thaw Chow Mein Noodles if need be. If they need to be ordered, they can be ordered prior to 10:AM from Freshpoint for an afternoon (same day) delivery, but they will most likely come in frozen. It is best to thaw out these noodles a day in advance or more.
- If the noodles need to be thawed in a hurry, the Combi Oven and its steam setting can be employed.
- Once the Noodles are malleable, break them apart (they come in a large block), and tray them up on large Sheet Trays. Then, as evenly as possible, disperse the remaining ingredients over them for seasoning, flavour, and texture.
- Steam again. Put into service trays - typically Hotel Pans or Half Hotel Inserts - and hold for service. It's best not to hold these for too long, however, of all of the starches - the Chow Mein does not degrade as quickly as others. That said - do not use this as an excuse to do off too much in advance.
Any questions? - Ask Chef...

Allergens: Method:
1) Smash black peppercorns slightly.
2) Combine water, crushed black pepeprcorns, bay leaf, sugar, garlic cloves, onion, rosemary, thyme, salt and lemon (make sure to give the lemons a good squeeze before throwing in the mix)
3) Bring brine to a boil and stir to ensure that salt and sugar are dissolved. Put mixture in blast chiller to cool.
4) When brine has cooled COMPLETELY, add turkey breast. Ensure breasts stay in brine by weighing them down with a tray from the servery.
5) Allow breast to brine for 6 hours.
6) Roast in 325*F oven until browned and probe thermometer reaches 70*C (158*F).
